text:
Hmm ... this is odd.
```julia> using Pipe
julia> row = " 1 2 "
" 1 2 "
julia> values = @pipe  strip(row) |> split(_, " ") .|> parse(Int, _)
ERROR: MethodError: objects of type Vector{SubString{String}} are not callable
Use square brackets [] for indexing an Array.
Stacktrace:
 [1] |>(x::SubString{String}, f::Vector{SubString{String}})
   @ Base ./operators.jl:859
 [2] top-level scope
   @ REPL[12]:1

julia> values = @pipe  strip(row) |> split(_, " ") 
2-element Vector{SubString{String}}:
 "1"
 "2"

julia> values = parse.(Int, values)
2-element Vector{Int64}:
 1
 2```
Why is the behavior different? :thinking_face:

julia> row = " 1 2 "
" 1 2 "
julia> values = @pipe  strip(row) |> split(_, " ") .|> parse(Int, _)
ERROR: MethodError: objects of type Vector{SubString{String}} are not callable
Use square brackets [] for indexing an Array.
Stacktrace:
 [1] |>(x::SubString{String}, f::Vector{SubString{String}})
   @ Base ./operators.jl:859
 [2] top-level scope
   @ REPL[12]:1

julia> values = @pipe  strip(row) |> split(_, " ")

 "1"
 "2"

julia> values = parse.(Int, values)

text: Can we cross post this publicly to <https://discourse.julialang.org|Discourse> for further visibility? React with :bridge: on the message above to approve. <https://github.com/JuliaCommunity/SlackBridge/blob/main/README.md#faq|More info here>

Never used the package but this explains the error:
```julia> @macroexpand  @pipe  strip(row) |> split(_, " ") .|> parse(Int, _)
:((strip(row) |> split(strip(row), " ")) .|> (var"##260"->begin
              #= /home/fredrik/.julia/packages/Pipe/5PIGG/src/Pipe.jl:46 =#
              parse(Int, var"##260")
          end))```

          end))

text:
Perhaps parsing/behavior of `.|>` is a bit strange. You can use this at least:
```julia> @pipe strip(row) |> split(_, " ") |> parse.(Int, _)
2-element Vector{Int64}:
 1
 2```
